App description:
Half + Half is a multiplayer game about fun & connection. The game includes five unique multiplayer spaces that are designed to help you connect with people you know, and also to connect with people you dont, even if only for a short while.

Swim in the ocean. Glide through clouds. Play human tetris with friends, or Hide & Seek where hiders are two inches tall, and seekers are as tall as buildings.

Every space in Half + Half is designed to be fun, but also to make you look as ridiculous as possible in real life. Half + Half is made to be fun for you, but also fun for everyone in the same room.

tl;dr Half+Half is fun, but its lacking

I love Half + Half. The characters are adorable, the environment is so surreal. I loved the intro at the start where the game welcomes you into a brand new world. And thats when I saw the doors.

In the first door was a gliding game where you control a hang-glider and have to push a ball in some hoops. I thought that was fun and the music the ball played was so relaxing, but after an hour of trying to get even one score, I noticed nothing happened. It became repetitive. Perhaps I needed to score more and was too impatient, or maybe its just better with more people, Im not really sure.

The second door was a mashup of Tetris Effect and a hole-in-the-wall type game. You were supposed to duck and lean to fit into 2d character silhouettes. This game was probably one of my favorites, because it let you take breaks, and it just kept on getting more and more challenging.

In the door in the middle was probably the most popular game: Hide and Seek! In this game, hiders are very small and can move around by loading a slingshot and firing at their destination. I thought this was an interesting and unique movement method, but it got annoying when it would accidentally bounce off a wall or ceiling if youre in a small space. Another part I wasnt really a fan of was that whenever you fire your slingshot you fire a character model that can be very easily seem by the seeker. I understand that this is a feature because it shouldnt be impossible for the seeker to spot you, but I think that its already tough enough.
The seeker, on the other hand, are gigantic compared to the hiders. The seeker moves by swinging their arms from side to side, a movement mechanic I thought was well implemented in this game. To catch the hiders, the seeker is equipped with a gravity ball (I think thats what its called) that they can throw. If a hider is hit with or caught in the blast zone of a gravity ball, theyre out. I hate the gravity balls, especially since the seeker can just spam them and throw them everywhere. If the developers added a short cooldown or something to the gravity balls, it would make life easier for anyone unfortunate enough to be a hider.

The fourth door is similar to the first door, whereas it involves controlling a hang-glider. However, the twist here is that the game is a 3rd person side-scroller. Players are given a horizontal bar that they must push down. Its like pumping gas into a bike wheel. Whenever you pump, your character flies up, and first player to the finish line wins. Oh
and there are also small wind currents that can boost you and help you get to the finish line faster.

The fifth, and final door involves swimming.
Just swimming.
You, fish, the ocean.
Just peace and quiet, if you want to relax.
If you move your arms in a swimming motion, you move forward. You can go up, down, and all around.
Just as long as youre not afraid of the ocean, youll be fine! (Youre fine anyways, its just a game)

So, in conclusion, I really like this game. I fell in love with it the second I saw the trailer. It seemed like a game Id love. And it was, kind of.
I think that right now, as Im writing this, that..
This could be better, there could be more. I think this game lacks content right now, and theres not a lot to do. You can play through it all in a couple of hours, and sure, you can play with friends, but itll get boring after a while.
I think this game is lacking right now, but I hope more will be added in the future! Keep on doing great things, Normal!
